page.title: 14Wytham Abbey
page.content: It is doubtful if Wytham Abbey was ever an abbey. It was a private estate owned by the Earls of Abingdon, and was restored early in the 19th Century Now it is a collection of flats owned by Oxford University. Outside, it seems an attractive 17th Century building, but inside it is a warren of corridors and appartments. The staircase from Cumnor Place, down which Amy Robsart fell to her death, is there, but the private path along which the ffenells, the last owners, walked to church, is gone. Trees hide their graves in the Abbey grounds. Some of the old family servants still live in their quarters around the northern courtyard, but the stables are in decay and the meat house is empty. The Abbey has become a quiet, sombre place, keeping its own secrets, the echoing halls defying modern times
